channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: PosterLayout: A New Benchmark and Approach for Content-aware Visual-Textual Presentation Layout
item.description: Content-aware visual-textual presentation layout aims at arranging spatial space on the given canvas for pre-defined elements, including text, logo, and underlay, which is a key to automatic template-free creative graphic design.

item.title: Projected Latent Distillation for Data-Agnostic Consolidation in Distributed Continual Learning
item.description: We formalize this problem as a Distributed Continual Learning scenario, where SCD adapt to local tasks and a CL model consolidates the knowledge from the resulting stream of models without looking at the SCD's private data.

item.title: Scalable, Detailed and Mask-Free Universal Photometric Stereo
item.description: In this paper, we introduce SDM-UniPS, a groundbreaking Scalable, Detailed, Mask-free, and Universal Photometric Stereo network.

item.title: Hyperbolic Geometry in Computer Vision: A Novel Framework for Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: To address this, we present HCNN, the first fully hyperbolic convolutional neural network (CNN) designed for computer vision tasks.

item.title: Explicit Planning Helps Language Models in Logical Reasoning
item.description: Language models have been shown to perform remarkably well on a wide range of natural language processing tasks.

item.title: Comparison of HDR quality metrics in Per-Clip Lagrangian multiplier optimisation with AV1
item.description: The complexity of modern codecs along with the increased need of delivering high-quality videos at low bitrates has reinforced the idea of a per-clip tailoring of parameters for optimised rate-distortion performance.

item.title: HS-Pose: Hybrid Scope Feature Extraction for Category-level Object Pose Estimation
item.description: In this paper, we focus on the problem of category-level object pose estimation, which is challenging due to the large intra-category shape variation.

item.title: Multi-Behavior Recommendation with Cascading Graph Convolution Networks
item.description: Most existing multi-behavior models fail to capture such dependencies in a behavior chain for embedding learning.

item.title: Uncovering the Missing Pattern: Unified Framework Towards Trajectory Imputation and Prediction
item.description: As far as we know, this is the first work to address the lack of benchmarks and techniques for trajectory imputation and prediction in a unified manner.

item.title: KERM: Knowledge Enhanced Reasoning for Vision-and-Language Navigation
item.description: The proposed KERM can automatically select and gather crucial and relevant cues, obtaining more accurate action prediction.

item.title: Few-Shot 3D Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation via Stratified Class-Specific Attention Based Transformer Network
item.description: While a few-shot learning method was proposed recently to address these two problems, it suffers from high computational complexity caused by graph construction and inability to learn fine-grained relationships among points due to the use of pooling operations.

item.title: qEUBO: A Decision-Theoretic Acquisition Function for Preferential Bayesian Optimization
item.description: Preferential Bayesian optimization (PBO) is a framework for optimizing a decision maker's latent utility function using preference feedback.

item.title: CREATED: Generating Viable Counterfactual Sequences for Predictive Process Analytics
item.description: Current methods to generate counterfactual sequences either do not take the process behavior into account, leading to generating invalid or infeasible counterfactual process instances, or heavily rely on domain knowledge.

item.title: LLaMA-Adapter: Efficient Fine-tuning of Language Models with Zero-init Attention
item.description: We present LLaMA-Adapter, a lightweight adaption method to efficiently fine-tune LLaMA into an instruction-following model.

item.title: TraffNet: Learning Causality of Traffic Generation for Road Network Digital Twins
item.description: Therefore, their performance is unreliable for JIT decision making.

item.title: Mask-Free Video Instance Segmentation
item.description: A consistency loss is then enforced on the found matches.

item.title: One Adapter for All Programming Languages? Adapter Tuning for Code Search and Summarization
item.description: To alleviate the potentially catastrophic forgetting issue in multilingual models, we fix all pre-trained model parameters, insert the parameter-efficient structure adapter, and fine-tune it.

item.title: On Feature Scaling of Recursive Feature Machines
item.description: In this technical report, we explore the behavior of Recursive Feature Machines (RFMs), a type of novel kernel machine that recursively learns features via the average gradient outer product, through a series of experiments on regression datasets.

item.title: Forecasting localized weather impacts on vegetation as seen from space with meteo-guided video prediction
item.description: We present a novel approach for modeling vegetation response to weather in Europe as measured by the Sentinel 2 satellite.

item.title: Your Diffusion Model is Secretly a Zero-Shot Classifier
item.description: Our generative approach to classification attains strong results on a variety of benchmarks and outperforms alternative methods of extracting knowledge from diffusion models.

item.title: SVD-DIP: Overcoming the Overfitting Problem in DIP-based CT Reconstruction
item.description: The deep image prior (DIP) is a well-established unsupervised deep learning method for image reconstruction; yet it is far from being flawless.

item.title: Offline RL with No OOD Actions: In-Sample Learning via Implicit Value Regularization
item.description: This gives a deeper understanding of why the in-sample learning paradigm works, i. e., it applies implicit value regularization to the policy.

item.title: Searching for long faint astronomical high energy transients: a data driven approach
item.description: The main objective of HERMES Pathfinder is to prove that accurate position of high-energy cosmic transients can be obtained using miniaturized hardware.

item.title: Thread Counting in Plain Weave for Old Paintings Using Semi-Supervised Regression Deep Learning Models
item.description: In this work the authors develop regression approaches based on deep learning to perform thread density estimation for plain weave canvas analysis.

item.title: Do Neural Topic Models Really Need Dropout? Analysis of the Effect of Dropout in Topic Modeling
item.description: Dropout is a widely used regularization trick to resolve the overfitting issue in large feedforward neural networks trained on a small dataset, which performs poorly on the held-out test subset.

item.title: Unsupervised Pre-Training For Data-Efficient Text-to-Speech On Low Resource Languages
item.description: We empirically demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed method in low-resource language scenarios, achieving outstanding performance compared to competing methods.

item.title: Novel View Synthesis of Humans using Differentiable Rendering
item.description: We show how our approach can be used for motion transfer between individuals; novel view synthesis of individuals captured from just a single camera; to synthesize individuals from any virtual viewpoint; and to re-render people in novel poses.

item.title: Metrics for Dataset Demographic Bias: A Case Study on Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: One of the most prominent types of demographic bias are statistical imbalances in the representation of demographic groups in the datasets.

item.title: Large-scale Pre-trained Models are Surprisingly Strong in Incremental Novel Class Discovery
item.description: Discovering novel concepts from unlabelled data and in a continuous manner is an important desideratum of lifelong learners.

item.title: SFHarmony: Source Free Domain Adaptation for Distributed Neuroimaging Analysis
item.description: Our method outperforms existing SFDA approaches across a range of realistic data scenarios, demonstrating the potential utility of our approach for MRI harmonisation and general SFDA problems.

item.title: Unmasked Teacher: Towards Training-Efficient Video Foundation Models
item.description: Previous VFMs rely on Image Foundation Models (IFMs), which face challenges in transferring to the video domain.

item.title: Hallucinations in Large Multilingual Translation Models
item.description: Large-scale multilingual machine translation systems have demonstrated remarkable ability to translate directly between numerous languages, making them increasingly appealing for real-world applications.

item.title: Distributed Graph Embedding with Information-Oriented Random Walks
item.description: Graph embedding maps graph nodes to low-dimensional vectors, and is widely adopted in machine learning tasks.

item.title: TFS-ViT: Token-Level Feature Stylization for Domain Generalization
item.description: This paper presents a first Token-level Feature Stylization (TFS-ViT) approach for domain generalization, which improves the performance of ViTs to unseen data by synthesizing new domains.

item.title: Scaling Multi-Objective Security Games Provably via Space Discretization Based Evolutionary Search
item.description: Then, a many-objective EA is used for optimization in the low-dimensional discrete solution space to obtain a well-spaced Pareto front.

item.title: A source separation approach to temporal graph modelling for computer networks
item.description: Detecting malicious activity within an enterprise computer network can be framed as a temporal link prediction task: given a sequence of graphs representing communications between hosts over time, the goal is to predict which edges should--or should not--occur in the future.

item.title: NeuralMind-UNICAMP at 2022 TREC NeuCLIR: Large Boring Rerankers for Cross-lingual Retrieval
item.description: This paper reports on a study of cross-lingual information retrieval (CLIR) using the mT5-XXL reranker on the NeuCLIR track of TREC 2022.

item.title: Explicit Attention-Enhanced Fusion for RGB-Thermal Perception Tasks
item.description: Specifically, we consider the following cases: i) both RGB data and thermal data, ii) only one of the types of data, and iii) none of them generate discriminative features.

item.title: AutoKary2022: A Large-Scale Densely Annotated Dateset for Chromosome Instance Segmentation
item.description: Automated chromosome instance segmentation from metaphase cell microscopic images is critical for the diagnosis of chromosomal disorders (i. e., karyotype analysis).

item.title: Learning a Deep Color Difference Metric for Photographic Images
item.description: Most well-established and widely used color difference (CD) metrics are handcrafted and subject-calibrated against uniformly colored patches, which do not generalize well to photographic images characterized by natural scene complexities.

item.title: Zero-Shot Composed Image Retrieval with Textual Inversion
item.description: Composed Image Retrieval (CIR) aims to retrieve a target image based on a query composed of a reference image and a relative caption that describes the difference between the two images.

item.title: unarXive 2022: All arXiv Publications Pre-Processed for NLP, Including Structured Full-Text and Citation Network
item.description: Large-scale data sets on scholarly publications are the basis for a variety of bibliometric analyses and natural language processing (NLP) applications.

item.title: Label-Free Liver Tumor Segmentation
item.description: We demonstrate that AI models can accurately segment liver tumors without the need for manual annotation by using synthetic tumors in CT scans.

item.title: Multi-Granularity Archaeological Dating of Chinese Bronze Dings Based on a Knowledge-Guided Relation Graph
item.description: The archaeological dating of bronze dings has played a critical role in the study of ancient Chinese history.

item.title: A large-scale dataset for end-to-end table recognition in the wild
item.description: To this end, we propose a new large-scale dataset named Table Recognition Set (TabRecSet) with diverse table forms sourcing from multiple scenarios in the wild, providing complete annotation dedicated to end-to-end TR research.

item.title: Recovering 3D Hand Mesh Sequence from a Single Blurry Image: A New Dataset and Temporal Unfolding
item.description: In addition to the new dataset, we propose BlurHandNet, a baseline network for accurate 3D hand mesh recovery from a blurry hand image.

item.title: Blind Image Quality Assessment via Vision-Language Correspondence: A Multitask Learning Perspective
item.description: We aim at advancing blind image quality assessment (BIQA), which predicts the human perception of image quality without any reference information.

item.title: Dimensionality Collapse: Optimal Measurement Selection for Low-Error Infinite-Horizon Forecasting
item.description: Implementations of both an approximate dynamic programming formulation and the proposed alternative are illustrated using an extended Kalman filter for state estimation, with results on simulated systems with limit cycles and chaotic behavior demonstrating a linear improvement in the CRLB as a function of the number of collapsing dimensions of the system.

item.title: Handwritten Text Generation from Visual Archetypes
item.description: Generating synthetic images of handwritten text in a writer-specific style is a challenging task, especially in the case of unseen styles and new words, and even more when these latter contain characters that are rarely encountered during training.

item.title: Joint Video Multi-Frame Interpolation and Deblurring under Unknown Exposure Time
item.description: Moreover, on the seemingly implausible x16 interpolation task, our method outperforms existing methods by more than 1. 5 dB in terms of PSNR.
